contents.title: About World Gourmet
contents.description: Welcome to our web blog dedicated to Ingredients and Recipes, a unique and pioneering platform where technology and culinary arts converge.

children.value: Welcome to our web blog dedicated to
, a unique and pioneering platform where technology and culinary arts converge.
This revolutionary blog isn't just about sharing appetizing recipes and highlighting exotic ingredients. We go a step further. We leverage the power of
(AI) to churn out innovative, delectable, and, above all, feasible recipes.

That way, not only do we cater to a vast spectrum of taste buds, but we also add value by introducing our readers to various new ingredients, thus expanding their culinary horizons. Each post aims to let you explore and understand an ingredient's potential while simultaneously providing an AI-generated recipe to embark on a gastronomic adventure!
Our blog is the brainchild of Alex Blackburn, a passionate web developer based out of Seattle who firmly believes in the ultimate potentials of technology: accessibility and creativity.
Alex Blackburn, a solo web developer, combines the thrill of creating mouth-watering dishes with sophisticated technology's power.
to get a glimpse of his works and learn more about his journey in tech and blogging.

Through this blog, Alex aspires to carve out a space that blends his love for culinary arts and technology, providing an exciting, innovative, and engaging platform for food lovers and tech enthusiasts alike.
So, get ready to embark on this thrilling journey of delicious tastes designed by AI!

contents.title: üó∫ World Gourmet üç¥
contents.description: Welcome to your one-stop culinary destination! World Gourmet is a markdown-based food blog specializing in dishes from all corners of the world. Here, you'll find recipes, ingredient breakdowns, and taste-tripping facts that take you on a journey through the delectable diversity of world cuisines.

children.value: Welcome to your one-stop culinary destination! World Gourmet is a markdown-based food blog specializing in dishes from all corners of the world. Here, you'll find recipes, ingredient breakdowns, and taste-tripping facts that take you on a journey through the delectable diversity of world cuisines.
Our blog is aimed at the gastronomic explorer within you, and provides content in the following categories:
We provide easy-to-follow markdown recipes, with detailed cooking instruction and images to help guide you on your global culinary journey.
Here we delve into the science, history, and cultural significance of ingredients used across various cuisines.

We believe the magic of food gets amplified when shared. We'd love to hear about your own recipes, cooking experiences, and cultural food facts. Share your stories with us and become a part of our global gastronomic community.
Here's a brief glimpse of our latest posts!
A tantalizing dessert layered with ladyfingers, coffee, and a rich mascarpone cream.
Did you know the Wasabi served in most sushi restaurants isn‚Äôt real Wasabi? Discover the history and uses of this Japanese horseradish.
Hit that subscribe button to get the latest updates directly in your inbox.
Just explore, learn, cook and most importantly, enjoy the delicious journey you are embarking on!

contents.title: Ingredients ü•ó
contents.description: Discover the world of ingredients, one spice, herb or vegetable at a time. Here, we delve into the rich history, unique uses, and nutritional values of ingredients from across the globe. Venture out the culinary sphere as you unravel the secrets of these gastronomic gems.

children.value: Discover the world of ingredients, one spice, herb or vegetable at a time. Here, we delve into the rich history, unique uses, and nutritional values of ingredients from across the globe. Venture out the culinary sphere as you unravel the secrets of these gastronomic gems.
Saffron, harvested from the fall-flowering plant

, is a priceless thread in the culinary world. Native to Greece and Southwest Asia, it is now cultivated globally. It takes an outstanding ~75,000 saffron blossoms to produce a single pound of saffron spice!
Here's a sneak peek into our comprehensive collection of cuisinary elements from around the globe:
A cornerstone of the mediterranean diet, Olive Oil is renowned for its health benefits and culinary uses.
Native to Mexico, chilli peppers pack heat and flavor. Uncover the varieties and uses of this fiery ingredient.
Aromatic and flavourful, Basmati rice forms the base of several delicious Indian dishes.
A staple in East Asian cuisine, Soy Sauce brings a savoury umami flavour to dishes.
Stay tuned for new ingredients every week and subscribe for email updates on the latest features!
A dash of knowledge can spice up your next meal!

Basmati rice is a variety of long grain rice, famous for its fragrance and delicate, nuanced flavor. Originating from the Indian sub-continent, it's particularly found in Indian, Pakistani, and other South Asian cuisines.
A 45-gram serving of uncooked basmati rice contains:
In many Indian and Pakistani dishes, basmati rice is often used in biryani and pilau dishes. It's also well-loved in Persian, Turkish, and Arabic cuisines, amongst others.

Basmati rice can be served in several ways. It makes an excellent side dish, particularly for Indian or Middle Eastern dishes. It can also be the main dish as is the case with the ever popular biryani, a savory Indian dish loaded with spiced basmati rice and meat.
The flavor and aroma of basmati rice are unique and unlike any other. The grain is also non-sticky, so you won't have to worry about clumps of rice sticking together.
Here are some delicious dishes highlighting the use of basmati rice:
A classic Indian dish made with chicken, basmati rice, and a blend of spices. It is flavorful and comfortingly delicious!
This traditional Persian dish uses basmati rice and lentils, with a mix of spices and dried fruit for added flavor and texture.
This Arabia-inspired dish uses basmati rice as a base, topped with flavorful seafood.
Basmati Rice and Olive Oil: A Time-Tested Marvel
Basmati rice can certainly stand alone as a perfectly cooked grain. This grain, however, becomes absolutely magical when cooked with a drizzle of

. The olive oil adds a richness and depth to the basmati rice, creating the perfect base for many dishes. The olive oil‚Äôs ability to highlight the natural flavors of the other ingredients it‚Äôs paired with makes it a perfect match for basmati rice.
Explore recipes using both basmati rice and olive oil in the links below:
A tangy and aromatic dish made using basmati rice, freshly squeezed lemon juice and extra virgin olive oil from the Mediterranean.
A creamy, luxurious risotto made with wild mushrooms, basmati rice, and flavorful Italian olive oil.
So, go ahead! Add some basmati rice to your pantry and start exploring these wonderful dishes. We're positive you'll love every single one of them!

contents.title: Chilli Peppers: The World's Hot Favourite

children.value: Chilli Peppers: The World's Hot Favourite

Chilli peppers, part of the capsicum family, are one of the most cherished and utilized spices across the globe. With deep roots in all manner of cuisines, from the subtly blending power of the Hungarian
to the fiery heat of the Indian
, chilli peppers never fail to enliven your taste buds and add
With a history going back more than 7500 years, chilli peppers were first cultivated in central-east Mexico before making their fiery journey across countries and continents.
, the world of chilli peppers is diverse and extensive.

Not just a spice powerhouse, chilli peppers are packed with health benefits too. They are rich in various vitamins and minerals but usually consumed in small amounts so do not provide significant amounts of these nutrients. However, they are very high in Vitamin C.
Fresh chillies can be stored in the refrigerator while dried ones should be kept in airtight containers in a cool, dark place. Whole fresh peppers can be frozen.
Experience the fiery delight in your dishes with these global recipes.
- Deliciously spicy, this traditional Italian sauce gets its heat from the chillies. A great partner for pasta, meatballs or bread.
- A Szechuan speciality, this stir-fry recipe blends the fiery taste of chillies with a succulent chicken base.
- Chili peppers, pineapple, and pork come together in a lip-smacking Mexican street-food favourite.
Did you know olive oil can be an excellent vehicle to carry the flavour of chillies? Check out our
spotlight and corresponding Mediterranean recipes to add more depth to your dishes.

contents.title: Olive Oil: The Golden Elixir
contents.description: Olive oil, often touted as the liquid gold due to its rich golden color and immense health benefits, is an essential part of culinary art worldwide. From the heart of the Mediterranean to tables all over the globe, olive oil is a crucial ingredient that adds a characteristic taste and wholesome goodness to the dishes.

children.value: Olive oil, often touted as the liquid gold due to its rich golden color and immense health benefits, is an essential part of culinary art worldwide. From the heart of the Mediterranean to tables all over the globe, olive oil is a crucial ingredient that adds a characteristic taste and wholesome goodness to the dishes.

The roots of olive oil can be traced back to the Mediterranean region. The cultivation of olive trees and the production of olive oil started more than 5000 years ago. Today, it is not just confined to Mediterranean cuisine but is an integral part of kitchens around the world.

Olive oil is rich in monounsaturated fats, antioxidants, and vitamin E which are crucial for heart health. It helps in reducing the risk of type-2 diabetes, and its anti-inflammatory properties aid in fighting diseases like arthritis and osteoporosis.

Olive oil adds a unique flavor to food. It is primarily used for saut√©ing, grilling, baking, or as a dressing in salads. The flavor profiles can range from fruity and sweet to grassy and peppery, depending upon the type of olive used and the extraction process.
Check out these recipes that showcase the versatility of olive oil:

When choosing olive oil, look for ones labeled 'extra virgin,' as they are obtained from the first press and contain the highest antioxidants. Store olive oil in a cool, dark place and use it within six months after opening for the best flavor.
The age-old culinary secret of olive oil is now no secret to the world. Add this sublime gift of nature to your kitchen and immerse in the golden charm of diverse gastronomies of the world.

contents.title: Saffron: The Golden Spice
contents.description: Welcome to our ingredient spotlight on one of the most jazzy and exquisite flavors in the world, Saffron. This golden strand is not just a spice, but a symbol of luxury, flair, and rich culinary history.

children.value: Welcome to our ingredient spotlight on one of the most jazzy and exquisite flavors in the world,
. This golden strand is not just a spice, but a symbol of luxury, flair, and rich culinary history.

, is considered as one of the most expensive spices by weight. The vibrant golden color, the aromatic scent, and the distinctive taste have cemented its place in the culinary world, and various cultures globally.
This spice is harvested by hand due to its delicate nature, and it takes approximately 75,000 saffron blossoms to produce a single pound of saffron spice, which contributes to its high price.
Saffron has a distinctively sweet, honey-like flavor with grassy notes. It imparts a bright golden-yellow hue to dishes and is cherished in cooking for its unique taste and color.
Saffron has several health benefits. It is known to improve mood, fight depression, aid in weight loss, improve digestion, and has potent antioxidant properties.
Saffron is used in various cuisines worldwide:
, it is used in the famous dish, Paella.
, it is used in Biryani and sweets.
, it is a key ingredient in Risotto alla Milanese.
, it is used to flavor and color dishes.
Here are some of our curated recipes that use saffron:
Saffron pairs well with ingredients like garlic, onions, tomatoes, white wine, and most importantly,
. It's almost magical how Olive oil enhances the aroma and unleashes the full flavor of Saffron.
So, what are you waiting for? Dive into the rich and enchanting world of Saffron and let your culinary imagination fly!
Find out more about our other stars in the

contents.title: Soy Sauce: The World's Umami Favourite

children.value: Soy Sauce: The World's Umami Favourite
Welcome to World Gourmet's feature on a powerful, flavor-evoking pantry staple used worldwide:

Soy sauce is a condiment derived from fermented soybeans mixed with roasted grain, brine, and a mold called Aspergillus. Soy sauce is widely used in East and Southeast Asian cuisine and is slowly gaining popularity worldwide. It adds a salty, umami kick to food, enhancing it with a burst of rich, complex flavors.
There are two main categories of Soy Sauce:
- It is a thin, light-brown sauce that imparts a salty flavor, often used in steamed and stir-fried dishes.
- This variant is thicker, less salty and boasts a deep, sweet flavor because of the addition of caramel and, occasionally, molasses. It is mostly used in cooking and marinating.
Beyond being a potent flavor enhancer, Soy Sauce offers a range of health benefits:
Whether you are making a quick stir-fry or a slow-cooked stew, soy sauce can transform your dish. Here are some World Gourmet recipes where you can find it as an essential ingredient:
is a popular choice in many countries for its flavor and health benefits. Explore our
page and dive into recipes that combine these two powerhouse ingredients!
Discover more about different ingredients and how they can transform your cooking on

contents.title: Wasabi: The Fiery Green Paste
contents.description: Welcome to our ingredient spotlight on the intense and potent flavor power-source, Wasabi. This dazzling green paste is not just a condiment, but a sign of tradition, fervor, and a unique culinary story.

children.value: Welcome to our ingredient spotlight on the intense and potent flavor power-source,
. This dazzling green paste is not just a condiment, but a sign of tradition, fervor, and a unique culinary story.
, obtained from the root of the

plant, is a staple accompaniment in Japanese cuisine. Its vivid green color, the nostril-tingling aroma, and the fiery taste have carved its standing in the gastronomic world, and diverse cultures globally.
Harvesting wasabi is a time-consuming process due to the specific conditions required for its growth, which contributes to its isinstance.

Wasabi has an extremely strong, hot flavor that is clean and sharp. This is followed by a sweet, almost nutty aftertaste. It provides a different kind of heat compared to red chili peppers, where the sharpness hits quickly and dissipates just as fast.
Wasabi has a multitude of health benefits. It is high in antioxidants, helps in detoxification, fights against bacteria, improves digestion, and may even help in prevention of certain cancers.
Wasabi is utilized in different ways across the globe:
, it is primarily used as a condiment for sushi and sashimi.
It is also mixed into sauces and dressings and used in noodle recipes.
, wasabi peas have become a popular snack.
Here are some of our suggested recipes that star wasabi:
Wasabi goes well with ingredients like soy sauce, ginger, sesame seeds, and most vitally,
. The mild, slightly sweet flavor of sushi rice perfectly balances the potent hotness of Wasabi.
So, set off firecrackers on your taste buds! Dive into the intense and invigorating world of Wasabi and let your culinary creativity soar!

contents.title: Recipes from Around the World üó∫
contents.description: Unleash the globetrotting gourmet in you with our collection of markdown recipes from every continent.

children.value: Unleash the globetrotting gourmet in you with our collection of markdown recipes from every continent.
A vegetable tour de force, Ratatouille is a celebration of fresh, healthy ingredients combined to create a dish packed with flavors.
to check out the full recipe with detailed instructions.
Our cooking world is constantly expanding. Don‚Äôt forget to bookmark this page to stay updated with our new recipe adventures! Happy Cooking! :chef:

contents.title: Arabian Seafood Rice
contents.description: Arabian Seafood Rice, or Sayadieh, is a popular seafood dish in the Middle East, a perfect combination of spices, rice, and fish, garnished with fried onions and served with a tahini sauce.

children.value: Arabian Seafood Rice, or Sayadieh, is a popular seafood dish in the Middle East, a perfect combination of spices, rice, and fish, garnished with fried onions and served with a tahini sauce.
Rinse the rice in cold water.
In a pot, heat the olive oil and saut√© the onions until golden brown. Remove half of the onions and set aside.
Add the fish, turmeric, salt, and pepper to the pot and top with water. Let it simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove the fish and add the rice to the pot. Cover and let it cook for 20 minutes.
Serve the rice topped with the fish fillets and the reserved onions.

contents.title: Arrabbiata
contents.description: Arrabbiata is an Italian pasta dish from Rome. It's made with garlic, tomatoes, and dried red chili peppers cooked in olive oil.

children.value: Arrabbiata is an Italian pasta dish from Rome. It's made with garlic, tomatoes, and dried red chili peppers cooked in olive oil.
1 tsp of dried red chili peppers
Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
In a separate pan, add the olive oil and saut√© the garlic until it's golden.
Add the tomatoes and chili peppers, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Combine the sauce with the pasta, and adjust the seasoning with salt.

contents.title: Asado
contents.description: Asado is a barbecue technique and the social event of having or attending a barbecue in Argentina. It generally includes beef ribs, sausages, and other cuts which are cooked on a grill.

children.value: Asado is a barbecue technique and the social event of having or attending a barbecue in Argentina. It generally includes beef ribs, sausages, and other cuts which are cooked on a grill.
Preheat a grill to medium high heat.
Season the beef ribs and sausages liberally with salt.
Cook the ribs and sausages on the grill, turning often, until browned and cooked to desired doneness.

contents.title: Biryani
contents.description: Biryani is an aromatic and flavourful dish from India that layers marinated meat and partially cooked rice before everything is cooked together. It‚Äôs made fragrant with various spices and is a complete meal in one dish.

children.value: Biryani is an aromatic and flavourful dish from India that layers marinated meat and partially cooked rice before everything is cooked together. It‚Äôs made fragrant with various spices and is a complete meal in one dish.
1 lb chicken, chopped into bite-sized pieces
Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pan, saut√© the onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add in the chicken, yoghurt, turmeric, cumin, and cinnamon.
Cook until the chicken is browned all over.
Add in the rinsed rice and chicken stock.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.

contents.title: Bobotie
contents.description: Bobotie is a delicious South African dish consisting of spiced minced meat baked with an egg-based topping, a delightful mix of sweet and savoury flavours.

children.value: Bobotie is a delicious South African dish consisting of spiced minced meat baked with an egg-based topping, a delightful mix of sweet and savoury flavours.
Preheat your oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Soak bread in milk, then squeeze out reserved milk for later use.
Fry the onion and garlic in a bit of oil until golden.
Add the curry powder and turmeric, stirring well.
Add the minced meat and cook until browned.
Remove from heat and add salt, pepper, and bread, mixing well.
Place mixture into a greased ovenproof dish.
Beat the eggs with the reserved milk, salt, and pepper, then pour over the meat.
Bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.

contents.title: Bratwurst
contents.description: Bratwurst is a type of German sausage made from pork, beef, or veal. Its name derives from old German, Br√§t- "finely chopped meat", and Wurst, "sausage".

children.value: Bratwurst is a type of German sausage made from pork, beef, or veal. Its name derives from old German, Br√§t- "finely chopped meat", and Wurst, "sausage".
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Once hot, add in the sliced onions and saut√© until just caramelized.
Place the bratwurst in the skillet and brown on each side.
After browning, add the beer and beef broth.
Let simmer on medium heat for about 15 minutes, or until the bratwursts are cooked through.
Serve hot on hoagie rolls with caramelized onions and mustard.

contents.title: Burgers
contents.description: There's something deliciously satisfying about a well-made burger. Packed with juicy ground beef, crisp lettuce, ripe tomatoes, and a soft but sturdy bun - it's a meal sure to please.

children.value: There's something deliciously satisfying about a well-made burger. Packed with juicy ground beef, crisp lettuce, ripe tomatoes, and a soft but sturdy bun - it's a meal sure to please.
Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix until well combined.
Divide the mix into 4 parts and shape each one into a burger patty.
Grill the patties for 5 minutes each side on medium heat.
Place a slice of cheddar on each patty about 1 minute before they are done to let it melt.
Assemble the burger: Start with the bun, followed by lettuce, patty, tomato, condiments, and finally the other half of the bun. Enjoy!

contents.title: Couscous
contents.description: Couscous is a traditional Berber dish of semolina which is cooked by steaming. It is traditionally served with a meat or vegetable stew spooned over it.

children.value: Couscous is a traditional Berber dish of semolina which is cooked by steaming. It is traditionally served with a meat or vegetable stew spooned over it.
Place the couscous in a bowl.
Pour the boiling water over the couscous, then add the olive oil and salt.
Cover the bowl and let the couscous absorb the water for about 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork before serving.

contents.title: Doro Wat
contents.description: Doro Wat is a spicy Ethiopian stew made with chicken and hard-boiled eggs. It's slow-cooked to develop deep, rich flavours.

children.value: Doro Wat is a spicy Ethiopian stew made with chicken and hard-boiled eggs. It's slow-cooked to develop deep, rich flavours.
In a large pot, saut√© the onions in a little bit of oil until they're soft and translucent.
Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Stir in the Berbere spice and tomato paste, and simmer for a few minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and stir until they're well coated in the sauce.
Cover the pot and let it simmer for about an hour, stirring occasionally.
Once the chicken is cooked through, add the hard-boiled eggs and cook for another 10 minutes.

contents.title: Empanadas
contents.description: Empanadas are a popular street food in many Latin American countries. They're typically filled with beef and vegetables, then fried or baked until golden.

children.value: Empanadas are a popular street food in many Latin American countries. They're typically filled with beef and vegetables, then fried or baked until golden.
In a pan, saut√© onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened.
Add ground beef to the pan and season with cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook until browned, then let cool.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Stuff each empanada dough with the beef filling, fold in half and seal edges with a fork.
Brush each empanada with beaten egg.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.

contents.title: Feijoada
contents.description: Feijoada is a hearty black bean stew from Brazil often served with rice, saut√©ed collard greens and a side of orange slices. It's a deeply flavored dish with multiple types of meat!

children.value: Feijoada is a hearty black bean stew from Brazil often served with rice, saut√©ed collard greens and a side of orange slices. It's a deeply flavored dish with multiple types of meat!
Cook the beans in a large saucepan of boiling water for about an hour, or until tender.
Drain the beans, reserving the liquid.
In another pan, saut√© the chopped onion and garlic until soft and golden.
Add the meat and brown it.
Add the cooked beans and reserved liquid, and then add the bay leaves and Feijoada seasoning.
Simmer gently for at least an hour, until the meat is tender.
Serve with rice and saut√©ed collard greens.

contents.title: Fish and Chips
contents.description: Fish and Chips is a classic British dish that consists of fried fish in crispy batter, served with chips (also known as fries in the US). It's a comforting and hearty meal!

children.value: Fish and Chips is a classic British dish that consists of fried fish in crispy batter, served with chips (also known as fries in the US). It's a comforting and hearty meal!
To make the batter, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
Gradually add in the beer, and whisk until smooth.
Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Dredge the fish fillets in the dredging flour, then dip them into the beer batter.
Fry the fish in batches, until golden brown and crispy.
Fry the chips in the same oil until golden and crisp.
Season with salt and serve with the fried fish.

contents.title: Focaccia
contents.description: Focaccia is a flat oven-baked Italian bread product similar in style and texture to pizza doughs. It may be topped with herbs or other ingredients.

children.value: Focaccia is a flat oven-baked Italian bread product similar in style and texture to pizza doughs. It may be topped with herbs or other ingredients.
Mix the flour, salt, yeast, olive oil, and water in a bowl. Knead for five minutes until smooth.
Cover and leave to rise in a warm place for up to 24 hours.
Preheat your oven to 220¬∞C. Press the dough into a rough rectangle on a baking sheet, then dimple with your fingers and sprinkle with sea salt.

contents.title: Gazpacho
contents.description: Gazpacho is a soup made of raw blended vegetables. It's a classic of Spanish cuisine and is usually served cold.

children.value: Gazpacho is a soup made of raw blended vegetables. It's a classic of Spanish cuisine and is usually served cold.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Season it with salt and pepper.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

contents.title: Greek Lemon Rice
contents.description: Greek Lemon Rice is a popular side dish in Greece, packed with flavors of lemon, garlic and herbs, and often served with chicken or fish.

children.value: Greek Lemon Rice is a popular side dish in Greece, packed with flavors of lemon, garlic and herbs, and often served with chicken or fish.
Rinse the rice in cold water.
In a pot, heat the olive oil and saut√© the garlic until fragrant.
Add the rice, chicken stock, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
Cover the pot and let it simmer until the rice is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Serve hot as a side dish.

contents.title: Hummus
contents.description: Hummus is a dip or spread made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic

children.value: Hummus is a dip or spread made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic
In a blender combine the chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, garlic, cumin, and salt.
Blend until creamy and well mixed.
Serve hummus with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

contents.title: Italian Wild Mushroom Risotto
contents.description: Italian Wild Mushroom Risotto is a rich, creamy and indulgent dish, traditional in Italy, featuring a beautiful combination of wild mushrooms, Arborio rice, and parmesan cheese, often accompanied with a glass of white wine.

children.value: Italian Wild Mushroom Risotto is a rich, creamy and indulgent dish, traditional in Italy, featuring a beautiful combination of wild mushrooms, Arborio rice, and parmesan cheese, often accompanied with a glass of white wine.
2 cups of mixed wild mushrooms, cleaned and chopped
In a pan, heat the olive oil and saut√© the onion and garlic until golden.
Add the mushrooms and cook until soft.
Add the Arborio rice to the pan and stir well to coat it in the oil.
Add a ladle of stock at a time, stirring until absorbed before adding the next one.
Continue this process until the risotto is creamy and the rice is cooked.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

contents.title: Jollof Rice
contents.description: Jollof Rice is a popular West African dish. It's a one-pot rice dish cooked with tomatoes, peppers, and spices with a vibrant and warm flavor profile.

children.value: Jollof Rice is a popular West African dish. It's a one-pot rice dish cooked with tomatoes, peppers, and spices with a vibrant and warm flavor profile.
2 cups of long grain parboiled rice
Blend tomatoes, green bell pepper, red bell pepper and onions. Set aside.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the tomato blend with garlic, thyme and curry powder for about 15 minutes.
Add the rice and stir until it's well coated with the tomato blend.
Pour in the chicken broth, add salt to taste, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and let simmer for about 30 minutes or until the rice is cooked.
Serve hot with your choice of protein.

contents.title: Kimchi
contents.description: Kimchi is a staple Korean side dish made of pickled and fermented cabbage. It's full of flavour from the chilli, garlic and other seasonings, and has great health benefits.

children.value: Kimchi is a staple Korean side dish made of pickled and fermented cabbage. It's full of flavour from the chilli, garlic and other seasonings, and has great health benefits.
Cut the cabbage into chunks, then place in a large bowl.
Sprinkle with the sea salt, then massage into the cabbage.
Let sit for 30 minutes to draw out water from the cabbage.
Mix in the other ingredients, wearing gloves to protect your hands from the chilli.
Pack tightly into a clean glass jar.
Ferment for at least a week before eating.

contents.title: Kung Pao Chicken
contents.description: Kung Pao Chicken is a classic dish in Sichuan cuisine. It is a stir-fry dish with chicken, peanuts, vegetables and chili peppers.

children.value: Kung Pao Chicken is a classic dish in Sichuan cuisine. It is a stir-fry dish with chicken, peanuts, vegetables and chili peppers.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with 1 tbsp of soy sauce and cornstarch for 15 mins.
In a hot pan, stir-fry the dried chili peppers until they darken.
Add the chicken pieces and stir-fry until they are browned.
Add the bell peppers, reduce the heat, add the remaining soy sauce, vinegar, and peanuts, stir-frying for a further 2 minutes.

contents.title: Pad Thai
contents.description: Pad Thai is a classic street food dish from Thailand. This recipe balances sweet, sour, salty and spicy in perfect harmony and is served with a garnishing of chopped peanuts.

children.value: Pad Thai is a classic street food dish from Thailand. This recipe balances sweet, sour, salty and spicy in perfect harmony and is served with a garnishing of chopped peanuts.
Cook the flat rice noodles according to instructions.
Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok.
Stir-fry the garlic for a minute before adding the shrimp.
Push the shrimp to one side and pour the eggs into the skillet.
Add noodles, bean sprouts, and peanuts into the skillet.
Stir-fry everything together for a few minutes, or until heated through.
Serve with a slice of lime.

contents.title: Paella
contents.description: Paella is a famed rice dish from Spain. With colorful ingredients like saffron-tinged rice, various meats, shellfish, and vegetables, it is renowned for being hearty and incredibly flavorful.

children.value: Paella is a famed rice dish from Spain. With colorful ingredients like saffron-tinged rice, various meats, shellfish, and vegetables, it is renowned for being hearty and incredibly flavorful.
1/2 pound chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
Heat olive oil in a large paella pan or similar over medium heat.
Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic and cook until soft.
Stir in the paella rice until well-coated in the oil.
Add the chicken broth and saffron, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the shrimp, mussels, chicken thighs, and peas.
Cook until the rice is tender, the seafood is cooked, and chicken is no longer pink in the center.
Squeeze lemon juice over the top before serving and garnish with wedges.

contents.title: Pasta Carbonara
contents.description: Pasta Carbonara is an Italian pasta dish from Rome with eggs, cheese (Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano), bacon, and pepper. It's creamy, delicious, and comforting!

children.value: Pasta Carbonara is an Italian pasta dish from Rome with eggs, cheese (Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano), bacon, and pepper. It's creamy, delicious, and comforting!
Boil the spaghetti in a pot of salted water until it is al dente.
Meanwhile, fry the pancetta in a hot pan until crispy.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and mix in both cheeses.
Once the spaghetti is cooked, drain it quickly so it's still wet, reserving some of the pasta water.
Add the hot spaghetti to the pancetta and mix well to coat in the fat.
Remove from the heat and quickly pour in the egg and cheese mixture.
Stir until the egg cooks slightly and forms a creamy sauce (add some reserved pasta water if necessary).
Season with plenty of black pepper and enjoy!

contents.title: Pavlova
contents.description: Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert named after the Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova. It has a crispy crust and is typically topped with fruit and whipped cream.

children.value: Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert named after the Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova. It has a crispy crust and is typically topped with fruit and whipped cream.
Fresh fruits and whipped cream for topping
Preheat your oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form.
Slowly add the sugar, one spoon at a time, while continuing to beat the eggs.
Once all the sugar is added, beat the mixture for a few more minutes until it's thick and glossy.
Fold in the vanilla extract, lemon juice, and cornstarch.
On a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, spoon the mixture into a circle.
Bake in your preheated oven for about 1 hour.
Let the pavlova cool completely before topping with fresh fruit and whipped cream.

contents.title: Persian Lentil Rice
contents.description: Persian Lentil Rice, also known as Adas Polo, is a delicious and nutritious combination of rice, lentils, and raisins, garnished with saut√©ed onion and traditionally served with chicken, beef, or lamb.

children.value: Persian Lentil Rice, also known as Adas Polo, is a delicious and nutritious combination of rice, lentils, and raisins, garnished with saut√©ed onion and traditionally served with chicken, beef, or lamb.
Rinse the rice and lentils separately in cold water.
In a skillet, saut√© the onion in olive oil until golden.
Add the lentils to the skillet and pour in water. Cook for about 15 minutes.
Add the rice to the skillet, followed by the raisins. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover the skillet and let it cook for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked.
Serve hot with your choice of meat.

contents.title: Pho
contents.description: Pho is a popular Vietnamese dish consisting of a spicy, clear bone broth, rice noodles, and thinly sliced meat. It is traditionally topped with fresh herbs, lime, and chilli.

children.value: Pho is a popular Vietnamese dish consisting of a spicy, clear bone broth, rice noodles, and thinly sliced meat. It is traditionally topped with fresh herbs, lime, and chilli.
Fresh coriander, basil, lime slices, chilli slices to taste
Char the halved onion and ginger in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the beef broth, star anise, and cinnamon sticks to the pot.
Bring to a simmer, then leave to steep for 30 minutes.
Strain to remove the solids, then return the broth to the pot.
Cook the flat rice noodles according to instructions.
Divide the noodles and thinly sliced beef among serving bowls.
Ladle hot broth over each bowl, which will cook the beef.
Serve with plentiful fresh herbs, lime slices, and chilli slices.

contents.title: Pierogi
contents.description: Pierogi are filled dumplings of Central and Eastern European origin, made by wrapping pockets of unleavened dough around a savory or sweet filling and cooking them in boiling water. They're hearty, comforting, and delicious!

children.value: Pierogi are filled dumplings of Central and Eastern European origin, made by wrapping pockets of unleavened dough around a savory or sweet filling and cooking them in boiling water. They're hearty, comforting, and delicious!
For the dough, mix together the flour and salt.
Beat the egg, sour cream, and butter together and add to the flour.
Mix until the dough comes together.
Knead the dough for about 3-4 minutes and then let it rest for 30 minutes.
For the filling, combine the mashed potatoes and cheddar cheese.
Roll out the dough and cut out round pieces using a circle cutter.
Place a small spoonful of the filling in the center of each round.
Fold the dough over and press to seal the edges.
Boil the pierogi in salted water for about 5 minutes, or until they float to the top.
Serve with sour cream or fried onions on top. Enjoy!

contents.title: Poke
contents.description: Poke is a traditional Hawaiian dish of chunky raw fish, usually tuna, marinated in soy sauce and sesame oil, often served over rice for a refreshing and hearty bowl.

children.value: Poke is a traditional Hawaiian dish of chunky raw fish, usually tuna, marinated in soy sauce and sesame oil, often served over rice for a refreshing and hearty bowl.
1 lb fresh tuna steak, cut into chunks
Serving options: steamed rice, salad greens
In a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic.
Add the tuna and green onions, stirring to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to 24 hours.
Serve the poke on its own or over steamed rice or salad greens.

contents.title: Poutine
contents.description: Poutine is a classic Canadian dish originating from Quebec. It consists of crispy fries topped with cheese curds and smothered in a rich gravy.

children.value: Poutine is a classic Canadian dish originating from Quebec. It consists of crispy fries topped with cheese curds and smothered in a rich gravy.
Bake or fry the French fries as instructed on the package until crispy.
Prepare the gravy according to the instructions on the packet.
Layer the fries and cheese curds in a dish. Pour hot gravy over the top to melt the cheese curds.

contents.title: Saffron Risotto
contents.description: Saffron risotto (Risotto alla Milanese) is a creamy, luxurious Italian dish made with rice and saffron spice.

children.value: Saffron risotto (Risotto alla Milanese) is a creamy, luxurious Italian dish made with rice and saffron spice.
In a large pan, saut√© the onion until translucent.
Add the rice and cook for 2 minutes until it's well coated. Add the white wine and stir until it's absorbed.
In a separate pot, heat the chicken stock and saffron threads. Add a ladle of hot stock to the rice and stir until absorbed.
Continue adding the stock, ladle by ladle, stirring continuously until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Add the Parmesan cheese and butter. Stir well and season with salt.

contents.title: Shawarma
contents.description: Shawarma is a popular Middle Eastern dish of roasted meat (usually lamb, chicken, or beef) served on flatbread. It's usually served with vegetables and a variety of sauces.

children.value: Shawarma is a popular Middle Eastern dish of roasted meat (usually lamb, chicken, or beef) served on flatbread. It's usually served with vegetables and a variety of sauces.
1 kg of chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
Fresh vegetables and sauces for serving
In a large bowl, mix together the olive oil, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken thighs and mix until they are well coated in the spice mix.
Allow the chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight if possible.
Grill the chicken on a medium heat for about 6-7 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked.
Slice the chicken and serve on warm pita bread with your choice of fresh vegetables and sauces.

contents.title: Sushi
contents.description: Sushi is a traditional Japanese dish typically consisting of vinegared rice, combined with ingredients like seafood, vegetables, and sometimes even tropical fruits. It's not only delicious but also a work of art, beautifully presented.

children.value: Sushi is a traditional Japanese dish typically consisting of vinegared rice, combined with ingredients like seafood, vegetables, and sometimes even tropical fruits. It's not only delicious but also a work of art, beautifully presented.
1 avocado, peeled, pitted, and thinly sliced
Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to instructions.
Mix in the rice vinegar and let cool completely.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of rice on the nori.
Arrange the cucumber, avocado, and sushi-grade fish on the rice.
Roll up the sushi using the mat, applying some pressure.
Cut the sushi roll into bite-sized pieces using a sharp knife.

contents.title: Tacos el Pastor
contents.description: Tacos el Pastor are a popular dish in central Mexico. The dish is made by cooking thin slices of marinated pork on a vertical rotisserie, similar to the way shawarma and gyros are made.

children.value: Tacos el Pastor are a popular dish in central Mexico. The dish is made by cooking thin slices of marinated pork on a vertical rotisserie, similar to the way shawarma and gyros are made.
Marinate the pork shoulder in a mix of the spices, vinegar, garlic and pineapple juice for a minimum of 4 hours, ideally overnight.
Grill or saut√© the pork until completely cooked through.
Slice and serve on tortillas. Top with pineapple, cilantro and onions.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

contents.title: Tapenade
contents.description: Tapenade is a savoury dish from the south of France. It's a spread made from capers, black olives, and anchovies.

children.value: Tapenade is a savoury dish from the south of France. It's a spread made from capers, black olives, and anchovies.
Combine all the ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth.
Taste and adjust the seasoning with more capers, lemon juice, or garlic as needed.

contents.title: Tiramisu
contents.description: Tiramisu is a popular coffee-flavoured Italian dessert. It is made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa. The recipe has been adapted into many varieties of cakes and other desserts.

children.value: Tiramisu is a popular coffee-flavoured Italian dessert. It is made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa. The recipe has been adapted into many varieties of cakes and other desserts.
1 cup strong brewed coffee, room temperature
In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until well blended.
Whisk in milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils. Boil gently for 1 minute, then remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.
In a medium bowl, beat cream and vanilla until stiff peaks form.
When the egg yolk mixture has cooled, mix in the whipped cream.
In a small shallow dish, combine coffee and rum.
Dip each ladyfinger into the coffee mixture and arrange in the bottom of a 9x9 inch baking dish.
Spread half of the cream mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat with remaining coffee-dipped ladyfingers.
Spread remaining cream mixture over the top and dust with cocoa powder.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, until set, before slicing and serving.

contents.title: Tzatziki
contents.description: Tzatziki is a traditional Greek dish. It's a sauce served with grilled meats, or it can be served as a dip.

children.value: Tzatziki is a traditional Greek dish. It's a sauce served with grilled meats, or it can be served as a dip.
Grate the cucumber and drain it in a colander.
Combine the Greek yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, dill, and grated cucumber in a bowl.
Season it with salt and pepper. Chill for at least one hour before serving.

contents.title: Wasabi Crusted Salmon
contents.description: Wasabi Crusted Salmon is a delicious and spicy way to prepare salmon. The crispy crust adds a nice texture to the tender fish, and the wasabi gives it a kick of heat.

children.value: Wasabi Crusted Salmon is a delicious and spicy way to prepare salmon. The crispy crust adds a nice texture to the tender fish, and the wasabi gives it a kick of heat.
Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Spread a thin layer of wasabi paste on the top of each fillet.
Press the panko breadcrumbs onto the wasabi paste to form a crust.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Place the salmon fillets in the skillet, crust side down, and cook for 3 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
Transfer the salmon fillets to a baking sheet, crust side up, and bake in the preheated oven for about 8 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.

contents.title: Wasabi Mashed Potatoes
contents.description: Wasabi Mashed Potatoes are a unique twist on traditional mashed potatoes. The addition of wasabi adds a spicy kick and vibrant green color to the dish.

children.value: Wasabi Mashed Potatoes are a unique twist on traditional mashed potatoes. The addition of wasabi adds a spicy kick and vibrant green color to the dish.
Place the cubed potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Add a pinch of salt to the water.
Bring the water to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
Add the butter and mash the potatoes using a potato masher or a fork.
Stir in the milk and wasabi paste until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

contents.title: Wasabi Pea Snack
contents.description: Wasabi Pea Snack is a crunchy and addictive snack that combines the heat of wasabi with the crunch of pea crisps. It's a perfect snack for any occasion.

children.value: Wasabi Pea Snack is a crunchy and addictive snack that combines the heat of wasabi with the crunch of pea crisps. It's a perfect snack for any occasion.
In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, vegetable oil, wasabi powder, sugar, and salt.
Add the dried green peas to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the sauce.
Spread the coated peas on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the peas are crunchy.
Remove from the oven and let the peas cool completely before serving.

children.title: Chilli Peppers: The World's Hot Favourite
Soy Sauce: The World's Umami Favourite
